businessSummary.oneLiner: Government and enterprise AI data analytics platform ‚Äî transforming from core US defense/intel partner to commercial AI powerhouse
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since AIP (AI Platform) launch, the commercial segment has grown explosively. Q4 2025 revenue $1.407B (+70% YoY), US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). 2026 US commercial guidance +115% growth. Closed at $137.20 on 2/27 (+0.92%), rising for 3 consecutive days. Outperformed during market selloff, proving its defensive AI play credentials. Motley Fool deep-dived the 115% US commercial growth guidance implications.
howTheyMakeMoney: US Government: DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
US Commercial: Enterprise AI/data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), fastest-growing segment
International Government: NATO allies and other foreign government contracts
International Commercial: Global enterprise customers (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers avg $94M/yr (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration, core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Government/defense data analysis and decision-making platform
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management
TITAN ‚Äî US Army next-gen intelligence system

keyMetrics.interpretation: High valuation at EPS $0.63. Reflects hyper-growth premium

keyMetrics.interpretation: FY2026 EPS $1.32 expected. Still at high premium

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: High for SaaS. Economies of scale taking effect

keyMetrics.name: PEG
keyMetrics.interpretation: Premium to growth, but reflects AI leader premium

growthDrivers.title: US Commercial +115% Guidance ‚Äî 'Everything Changes'
growthDrivers.description: Motley Fool analysis: 115% US commercial growth guidance proves AIP adoption is accelerating. Revenue, margins, and FCF expanding simultaneously.

growthDrivers.title: 3 Consecutive Days Up ‚Äî Defensive AI Play in Market Selloff
growthDrivers.description: 2/27: Dow -521, Nasdaq -0.92%, but PLTR +0.92%. 3 days of consecutive gains proving defensive characteristics.

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA ‚Äî No-Bid Procurement
growthDrivers.description: Signed $1B 5-year BPA with DHS (2/19). CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding.

growthDrivers.title: UBS Buy Upgrade + Rosenblatt Buy Initiation
growthDrivers.description: UBS upgraded Neutral‚ÜíBuy ($180), Rosenblatt initiated Buy coverage ($150). Institutional sentiment turning.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Undisputed #1 in government/defense AI, rapidly building commercial AI position through AIP. Irreplaceable in data security + AI integration.

moats.description: Highest-level clearances with CIA, NSA, DHS. DHS BPA enables no-bid procurement.
More customers ‚Üí better AI models ‚Üí more customers. Virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. DHS 5-year BPA proves stickiness.

competitors.detail: Private, data lakehouse. Competes in enterprise AI.

competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly behind in growth and scale.

recentNews.significance: Deep analysis of US commercial 115% growth guidance financial impact. Revenue, margins, FCF all accelerating.

recentNews.significance: 60% gain over past year followed by healthy 17% correction. Improving earnings and profitability trend.

analystOpinions.notableComment: UBS Buy ($180), Rosenblatt Buy ($150). Trefis '17% correction = re-entry'. InvestorPlace provides balanced bull/bear analysis.

risks.title: P/E 218x ‚Äî AI Premium Sustainability Questionable
risks.description: Forward P/E 104x. High valuation burden despite strong growth. InvestorPlace raises '5 key questions'.

risks.title: Insider Selling Continues
risks.description: Executive auto-sell plans ongoing. SBC dilution +4.67% YoY.

risks.title: Government Budget Cut Risk
risks.description: DOGE and budget reduction movements could impact government contracts.

risks.title: Competition Intensifying ‚Äî Percepta AI, etc.
risks.description: Former Palantir key employees' Percepta AI entering competition.

risks.title: Political Risk ‚Äî Immigration/Surveillance Controversy
risks.description: ICE contracts create ESG and reputational risks.

buyReasons.title: 115% US Commercial Growth Guidance ‚Äî Game Changer
buyReasons.rationale: Motley Fool: Revenue, margins, FCF all accelerating simultaneously. AIP adoption acceleration proven.

buyReasons.title: 3 Consecutive Days Up in Market Selloff ‚Äî Defensive AI
buyReasons.rationale: Defensive gains despite macro headwinds. AI leader premium proven.

buyReasons.title: 34% Below 52-Week High + 17% Correction Zone
buyReasons.rationale: Trefis: Healthy correction after 60% surge. Re-entry opportunity.

buyReasons.title: Net Cash $6.95B + ROIC 272%
buyReasons.rationale: Virtually debt-free with ultra-efficient capital deployment. Ample AI investment capacity.

overallOpinion: Palantir closed at $137.20, rising 3 consecutive days and proving defensive strength during market selloff. 115% US commercial growth guidance is the key catalyst.
P/E 218x remains a burden, but +70% revenue growth, 31.5% operating margin, and 272% ROIC make it the strongest fundamental story in AI. Trefis views the 17% correction as a re-entry opportunity.

As Motley Fool's 'Everything Changes' analysis suggests, if AIP is truly accelerating enterprise AI adoption, today's premium could be justified. However, execution risk at this valuation is elevated.
